==Events==
* [[456]] &ndash; The [[Visigoths]] under king [[Theodoric II]], acting on orders of the Roman emperor [[Avitus]], invade [[Iberia]] with an army of [[Burgundians]], [[Franks]] and [[Goths]], led by the kings [[Chilperic I of Burgundy|Chilperic I]] and [[Gondioc]]. They defeat the [[Suebi]] under king [[Rechiar]] on the river [[Órbigo|Urbicus]] near [[Astorga, Spain|Astorga]] ([[Gallaecia]]).
* [[610]] &ndash; Coronation of [[Byzantine Emperor]] [[Heraclius]].
* [[869]] &ndash; The [[Fourth Council of Constantinople (Roman Catholic)|Fourth Council of Constantinople]] is convened to decide about what to do about patriarch [[Photios I of Constantinople|Photius]] of [[Constantinople]].
*[[1143]] &ndash; King [[Alfonso VII]] of [[Kingdom of León|León]] recognises Portugal as a Kingdom.
*[[1450]] &ndash; Jews are expelled from [[Lower Bavaria]] by order of [[Louis IX, Duke of Bavaria]].
*[[1550]] &ndash; Foundation of [[Concepción, Chile|Concepción]], city in [[Chile]].
*[[1582]] &ndash; Because of the implementation of the [[Gregorian calendar]] this day does not exist in this year in Italy, Poland, Portugal and Spain.
*[[1665]] &ndash; The [[University of Kiel]] is founded.
*[[1789]] &ndash; [[French Revolution]]: Women of Paris march to [[Palace of Versailles|Versailles]] in the [[Women's March on Versailles|March on Versailles]] to confront [[Louis XVI of France]] about his refusal to promulgate the decrees on the abolition of [[feudalism]], demand bread, and have the King and his court moved to Paris.
*[[1793]] &ndash; [[French Revolution]]: [[Dechristianisation of France during the French Revolution|Christianity is disestablished]] in France.
*[[1813]] &ndash; [[Battle of Thames]] in Canada; Americans defeat British and kill [[Shawnee]] leader [[Tecumseh]].
*[[1857]] &ndash; The City of [[Anaheim, California]] is founded.
*[[1864]] &ndash; The Indian city of [[Kolkata|Calcutta]] is almost totally destroyed by a [[cyclone]]; 60,000 die.
*[[1869]] &ndash; The [[Saxby Gale]] devastates the [[Bay of Fundy]] region of Maritime Canada. The storm had been predicted over a year before by a British naval officer.<!-- Seems unlikely given how fast weather patterns change -->
*[[1877]] &ndash; [[Chief Joseph]] surrenders his [[Nez Perce people|Nez Perce]] band to General [[Nelson A. Miles]].
*[[1895]] &ndash; The first [[individual time trial]] for racing cyclists is held on a 50-mile course north of London.
*[[1903]] &ndash; [[Samuel Griffith|Sir Samuel Griffith]] is appointed the first [[Chief Justice of Australia]] and [[Edmund Barton|Sir Edmund Barton]] and [[Richard O'Connor (politician)|Richard O'Connor]] are appointed as foundation justices.
*[[1905]] &ndash; [[Wilbur Wright]] pilots [[Wright Flyer III]] in a flight of 24 miles in 39 minutes, a world record that stood until 1908.
*[[1910]] &ndash; In a [[5 October 1910 revolution|revolution]] in Portugal the [[list of Portuguese monarchs|monarchy]] is overthrown and a republic is declared.
*[[1911]] &ndash; The [[Guangdong Through Train|Kowloon-Canton Railway]] (split into [[MTR]] [[East Rail Line]] and [[Guangshen Railway]] now) commences service between [[Kowloon]] and [[Guangzhou|Canton]].
*[[1914]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: first aerial combat resulting in an intentional fatality.
*[[1915]] &ndash; [[Bulgaria]] enters World War I as one of the [[Central Powers]].
*[[1921]] &ndash; [[Baseball]]: The [[World Series]] is broadcast on the radio for the first time.
*[[1930]] &ndash; British [[Airship R101]] crashes in France ''en route'' to India on its maiden voyage.
*[[1936]] &ndash; The [[Jarrow March]] sets off for London.
*[[1938]] &ndash; In Nazi Germany Jews' [[Nuremberg Laws|passports were invalidated]], and those who needed a passport for emigration purposes were given one marked with the letter J (Jude – Jew).
*[[1943]] &ndash; 98 American POW's executed by Japanese forces on [[Wake Island]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; Royal Canadian Air Force pilots shoot down the first German [[Jet aircraft|jet fighter]] over France.
*  1944   &ndash; [[Women's suffrage#France|Suffrage]] is extended to women in France.
*[[1945]] &ndash; [[Hollywood Black Friday]]: A six-month strike by [[Hollywood]] [[set decorator]]s turns into a bloody riot at the gates of [[Warner Bros.|Warner Brothers]]' studios.
*[[1947]] &ndash; The first televised [[White House]] address is given by [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Harry S. Truman]].
*[[1948]] &ndash; The [[1948 Ashgabat earthquake]] kills 110,000.
*[[1953]] &ndash; The first documented recovery meeting of [[Narcotics Anonymous]] is held.
*[[1955]] &ndash; [[Disneyland Hotel (California)|Disneyland Hotel]] opens to the public in [[Anaheim, California]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; ''[[Dr. No (film)|Dr. No]]'', the first in the [[James Bond in film|James Bond film series]], is released.
*  1962   &ndash; [[The Beatles|The Beatles']] first single, "[[Love Me Do]]" backed with "[[P.S. I Love You (song)|P.S. I Love You]]", is released in the United Kingdom.
*[[1966]] &ndash; Near [[Detroit|Detroit, Michigan]], there is a partial core meltdown at the [[Enrico Fermi Nuclear Generating Station|Enrico Fermi demonstration nuclear breeder reactor]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; Police baton [[Northern Ireland Civil Rights Association|civil rights]] demonstrators in [[Derry]], [[Northern Ireland]] &ndash; considered to mark the beginning of [[The Troubles]].
*[[1969]] &ndash; The first episode of ''[[Monty Python's Flying Circus]]'' airs on [[BBC One]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; The [[Public Broadcasting Service]] (PBS) is founded.
*  1970   &ndash; [[Montreal]]: British Trade Commissioner [[James Cross]] is kidnapped by members of the [[Front de libération du Québec|FLQ]] terrorist group, triggering the [[October Crisis]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; Signature of the [[European Patent Convention]].
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[Guildford pub bombings]]: bombs planted by the [[Provisional Irish Republican Army]] (IRA) kill four British soldiers and one civilian.
*[[1975]] &ndash; [[Operation Primicia]]: terrorist attack against a Military Regiment at [[Formosa, Argentina]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; [[Chicago Tylenol murders]]: [[Johnson & Johnson]] initiates a nationwide [[product recall]] in the United States for all products in its [[Tylenol]] brand after several bottles in Chicago are found to have been laced with [[cyanide]], resulting in seven deaths.
*[[1984]] &ndash; [[Marc Garneau]] becomes the first [[Canadian space program|Canadian in space]], aboard the [[Space Shuttle]] ''[[Space Shuttle Challenger|Challenger]]''.
*[[1986]] &ndash; [[Nuclear weapons and Israel|Israeli secret nuclear weapons]] are revealed. The British newspaper ''[[The Sunday Times (UK)|The Sunday Times]]'' runs [[Mordechai Vanunu]]'s story on its front page under the headline: "Revealed — the secrets of Israel's nuclear arsenal".
*[[1988]] &ndash; The [[Chile]]an opposition coalition ''[[Coalition of Parties for Democracy|Concertación]]'' (center-left) defeats [[Augusto Pinochet]] in [[Chilean national plebiscite, 1988|his re-election attempt]] and a [[general election]] is called the following year.
*  1988   &ndash; The [[Brazilian Constitution]] is ratified by [[Constituent Assembly]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; After one hundred and fifty years ''The Herald'' [[broadsheet]] newspaper in [[Melbourne]], Australia, is published for the last time as a separate newspaper.
*[[1991]] &ndash; An [[Indonesia]]n military transport crashes after takeoff from [[Jakarta]] killing 137.
*  1991   &ndash; The first official version of the [[Linux kernel]], version 0.02, is released.

*[[1999]] &ndash; The [[Ladbroke Grove rail crash]] in west London kills 31 people.
*[[2000]] &ndash; Mass demonstrations in [[Belgrade]] lead to resignation of [[Serbia]]n strongman [[Slobodan Milošević]]. These demonstrations are often called the [[Overthrow of Slobodan Milošević|Bulldozer Revolution]].
*[[2001]] – [[Barry Bonds]] surpassed [[Mark McGwire]]'s single-season [[home run]] total with his [[List of milestone home runs by Barry Bonds|milestone 71st and 72nd home runs]].
*[[2011]] &ndash; In the [[Mekong River massacre]], two Chinese cargo boats are hijacked and 13 crew members murdered in the lawless [[Golden Triangle (Southeast Asia)|Golden Triangle]] region of [[Southeast Asia]].
